data:
Verification method 
See RS attribute: "H_TestLevel"
Verification environment
Bench Test at room temperature of ~22°
Verification condition
The conditions to qualify the DTC are respected according to the details from PH_Ereignisspeicher_DAS_VW_02
Verification constraints
There are no special constrains
Success criteria
The corresponding DTC is set and read via the available UDS Commands such as Service 0x19 - ReadDTCInformation

When the complete system "RADAR Functionality" is in state 'ECU Operating mode Application' with "Ident_SensorID" == ['ECU0'| 'ECU1'|'ECU8'|'ECU9'] and condition ( « message "Klemmen_Status_01" is not received ») then the function "S11_Determine_provide_warning_information" shall « set Lost Communication DTC 0xE000D1 as per definition from [PH_Ereignisspeicher_DAS_VW_02] defining as example the associated qualification time or test enable criteria».

Verification method:
Requirement Based Test

Verification environment:
RBS

Verification condition:
ECU at Normal Operation state.
All ECU IDs.
Codings parameters are valid (MEB or MQB)

Verification constrains:
No special constraints

Success Criteria:
#Postiive Test
The RHP feature enables TLT E2E protection in all sensors. 
Verify the customization of signal "TLT_Req_NR_01/02/03/04".

#Negative Test
Only NORM relevant, no specific.

ECU0
ECU1
ECU2
ECU3
ECU8
ECU9

[PO_01_RS_93637]
IF	"Ident_SensorID" == 'ECU0' OR 'ECU8', THEN: the function "TLT Customizing Function" shall «set "TLT_Req_NR_03_CRC_XIX_TLT_Req_NR_03_XIX_FASCANFD2" := "Cust_TLTSlaveNRx_CRC"»       // Nanoradar NR_3

ELSE IF "Ident_SensorID"  == 'ECU1' OR 'ECU9', THEN: the function "TLT Customizing Function" shall «set "TLT_Req_NR_04_CRC_XIX_TLT_Req_NR_04_XIX_FASCANFD2" := "Cust_TLTSlaveNRx_CRC"»       // Nanoradar NR_4

ELSE IF "Ident_SensorID"  == 'ECU2', THEN: the function "TLT Customizing Function" shall «set "TLT_Req_NR_01_CRC_XIX_TLT_Req_NR_01_XIX_FASCANFD1" := "Cust_TLTSlaveNRx_CRC"»       // Nanoradar NR_1
 
ELSE IF "Ident_SensorID"  == 'ECU3', THEN: the function "TLT Customizing Function" shall «set "TLT_Req_NR_02_CRC_XIX_TLT_Req_NR_02_XIX_FASCANFD1" := "Cust_TLTSlaveNRx_CRC"».       // Nanoradar NR_2

//  else branch is not considered because it's equal to 'ECU0' - behaviour defined and realized by Feature "Sensor Identification (Ident)".

@Test case:
Check the function "TLT Customizing Function" shall set as requirement
min == 0
min+1 == 1
max == 255
max - 1 = 254
random value: 127

//Negative case
*Case 61:

- "Ident_SensorID"  := 'ECU4'
Check:
Not expected to check
// Negative case for ECU  <>  ECU0,  ECU1,  ECU2,  ECU3,  ECU8,  ECU9. Other sensor (ex. ECU4) is not applicable for SW configuration and RBS file is unavaible for testing

*Case 62:
Set: 
- "DiagCodingPlattformVW02" ==['3: MEB']
- "Ident_SensorID"  := 'ECU4'
Check:
Not expected to check
// Negative case for ECU  <>  ECU0,  ECU1,  ECU2,  ECU3,  ECU8,  ECU9. Other sensor (ex. ECU4) is not applicable for SW configuration and RBS file is unavaible for testing

IF	"Ident_SensorID" == 'ECU0' OR 'ECU8', THEN: the function "TLT Customizing Function" shall «set "TLT_Req_NR_03_CRC_XIX_TLT_Req_NR_03_XIX_FASCANFD2" := "Cust_TLTSlaveNRx_CRC"»       // Nanoradar NR_3

ELSE IF "Ident_SensorID"  == 'ECU1' OR 'ECU9', THEN: the function "TLT Customizing Function" shall «set "TLT_Req_NR_04_CRC_XIX_TLT_Req_NR_04_XIX_FASCANFD2" := "Cust_TLTSlaveNRx_CRC"»       // Nanoradar NR_4

ELSE IF "Ident_SensorID"  == 'ECU2', THEN: the function "TLT Customizing Function" shall «set "TLT_Req_NR_01_CRC_XIX_TLT_Req_NR_01_XIX_FASCANFD1" := "Cust_TLTSlaveNRx_CRC"»       // Nanoradar NR_1

[PO_01_RS_86442]
The function "End-To-End Communication Protection (E2E)" shall «use the maximum DLC configured in the sender/receiver to calculate and evaluate the CRC-8. The DLC value transmitted with the message must not be used in this context».

/* Remark:
For SOK-secured messages, the hash-value is calculated after the CRC-8 calculation. */

// [A: KomAbs_1316]

[PO_01_RS_86930]
The purpose of the function "E2E Processing Sender" is to «process the "End-To-End Communication Protection (E2E)" for S-PDUs to be send via "Vehicle Bus Customizing (VBC)" and "Warning Algorithms (WA)"».

[PO_01_RS_86582]
When function "E2E State Machine" is in state 'E2E_MONITORING_ACTIVE_NORMAL' then it shall «forward faultless S-PDUs to the application for further processing».

// [A: KomAbs_784]
// [A: KomAbs_1048]
// [A: KomAbs_1183]

[PO_01_RS_86583]
When function "E2E State Machine" is in state 'E2E_MONITORING_ACTIVE_SAFE_STATE' then it shall «not forward faultless S-PDUs to the application for further processing. The last valid values shall be used by the application for further processing».

// [A: KomAbs_784]
// [A: KomAbs_124]
// [A: KomAbs_1052]

[PO_01_RS_72243]
When function "E2E State Machine" is in state 'E2E_MONITORING_ACTIVE_SAFE_STATE_PERMANENT' then it shall «not forward S-PDUs to the application for further processing. The last valid values shall be used by the application for further processing».

// [A: KomAbs_784]
// [A: KomAbs_124]
// [A: KomAbs_1064]

[PO_01_RS_86448]
The function "E2E Processing Sender" shall «keep the sequence of the data bytes by calculating the CRC-8 checksum starting from the first data byte, taking byte by byte, up to the last data byte. The byte order of the S-PDU to be protected must correspond to the byte order on the bus».

// [A: KomAbs_1030]
// [A: KomAbs_332]
// [A: KomAbs_1220]

[PO_01_RS_85121]
The purpose of the function "End-To-End Communication Protection (E2E)" is to «secure all safety related information which is send to the vehicle communication interface, and to to check all safety related information which is received from vehicle communication interface».

[PO_01_RS_51437]
The purpose of the function "Vehicle Bus Normalization (VBN)" is to «normalize the customer specific communication input information for further processing in other Features».

---------------------------------- Test note -----------------------------------------
Scenario 1:
Positive Test:
Check that no MessageCounter / CRC / Timeout SW-Events/Errors/DTCs 
are set during normal operation using RBS:
- "Cust_X_XIX_FASCANFDxSequenceError" 
- "Cust_X_XIX_FASCANFDxCRCError"
- "Cust_X_XIX_FASCANFDxLostCommError" 

Scenario 2:
Perform CRC  fault injection via RBS CAN and check that in case of wrong information, 
the messages are not updated inside SW (will remain previous value, visible also via PCOM Development Data output).
Depending on the fault injection, one of the following Errors/DTCs shall be set:
- "Cust_X_XIX_FASCANFDxSequenceError" 
- "Cust_X_XIX_FASCANFDxCRCError"
- "Cust_X_XIX_FASCANFDxLostCommError"

Scenario 3:
Negative Test BZ:
Perform BZ fault injection via RBS CAN and check that in case of wrong information, 
the messages are not updated inside SW (will remain previous value, visible also via PCOM Development Data output).
Depending on the fault injection, one of the following Errors/DTCs shall be set:
- "Cust_X_XIX_FASCANFDxSequenceError" 
- "Cust_X_XIX_FASCANFDxCRCError"
- "Cust_X_XIX_FASCANFDxLostCommError"

Scenario 4:
Perform LOSTCOMM fault injection (invalid MessageCounter / invalid CRC / Timeout) via RBS CAN and check that in case of wrong information, 
the messages are not updated inside SW (will remain previous value, visible also via PCOM Development Data output).
Depending on the fault injection, one of the following Errors/DTCs shall be set:
- "Cust_X_XIX_FASCANFDxSequenceError" 
- "Cust_X_XIX_FASCANFDxCRCError"
- "Cust_X_XIX_FASCANFDxLostCommError"

Possitive case:
When message Anhaenger_01 is missing:
IF coding is MQB:
	DTC 0xE000D0 - Datenbus fehlende Botschaft - Anhaenger_01 shall be observed in both NR3 and NR4

IF coding is MEB:
	DTC 0xE000D0 - Datenbus fehlende Botschaft - Anhaenger_01 shall be observed in NR4 only

Negative case:
IF coding is different from either MEB or MQB, DTC 0xE000D0 - Datenbus fehlende Botschaft is not observed when message Anhaenger_01 is missing

	("Ident_SensorID" equal to 'ECU0'| 'ECU1'| 'ECU8'|'ECU9' and "DiagCodingPlattformVW02" == '1: MQB37W')

Success Criteria:
Verifying the NRC78 behavior with the corresponding DIDs.
DID 0x0600 shall return NRC78 as Operation Write needs long time to complete

For the following Ecu Identification data, the Response Pending [0x78] isn't allowed according to [Q-LAH_80124-9942]:
•  0x0600 - NR Coding Value (Coding).
•  0xF187 - VW Spare Part Number (VW/Audi-Teilenummer ) 
•  0xF189 - VW Software Version Number (Softwareversion) 
•  0xF191 - VW Hardware Number (Hardwareteilenummer) 
•  0xF197 - VW System Name Or Engine Type (Systembezeichnung) 
•  0xF19E - ASAM ODX File Identifier (ASAM/ODX Datei Kennzeichnung) 
•  0xF1A2 - ASAM ODX File Version (ASAM/ODX Dateiversion) 
•  0xF1A3 - VW ECU Hardware Version Number (Hardwareversion) 
•  0xF1AA - VW Workshop System Name (Systemkurzzeichen).

Success criteria
System Test Scenario 1:
Start with a calibrated ECU and force ECU to be in "SysStM_StateInfo" != 'ApplSW_ACTIVE->perform a reset and wait 2 seconds and check that DTC 0x000024 Kalibrierung  is Not active 

Software Test Scenario 1 :
Start with a calibrated ECU ->perform a reset and wait 2 seconds then check "AAC_AzimuthAutoalignmentCustomerCalibrationProgress" == 100% AND "Diag_CalibrationNotPerformedError" := 'NotDetected'

[PO_01_RS_102018]
The function "Diag UDS Processing" shall «set "Diag_CalibrationNotPerformedError" as 'NotDetected'  if the following conditions are met
	 AAC_AzimuthAutoalignmentCustomerCalibrationProgress is available max. 2s after StartUp. //2s is elapsed after step_1 (PO_01_RS_102017)
AND
	"AAC_AzimuthAutoalignmentCustomerCalibrationProgress" == 100%

CASE 1: (Same as Software Test Scenario 1 on H_TestCriterion)
SET:
	Step 1 is precondition:
		"Diag_CalibrationFinished_CFG" = 'true'
		"DiagVarCalibrationResetPerformed" = 'true
	Wait 2s after StartUp
	"AAC_AzimuthAutoalignmentCustomerCalibrationProgress"  is available max = 100%
CHECK:
	"Diag_CalibrationNotPerformedError" := 'NotDetected'
	
CASE 2:(Negative)  (Same as Software Test Scenario 2 on H_TestCriterion of Requirement 102019)
SET:
	Step 1 is precondition:
		"Diag_CalibrationFinished_CFG" = 'true'
		"DiagVarCalibrationResetPerformed" = 'true
	Wait 2s after StartUp
	"AAC_AzimuthAutoalignmentCustomerCalibrationProgress"  is available but  < 100% (=90%)
CHECK:
	"Diag_CalibrationNotPerformedError" := 'Detected'  //(Based on ELSE case of Requirement 102019)

CASE 3:(Negative) 
SET:
	Step 1 is precondition:
		"Diag_CalibrationFinished_CFG" = 'true'
		"DiagVarCalibrationResetPerformed" = 'true
	Wait 2s after StartUp
	"AAC_AzimuthAutoalignmentCustomerCalibrationProgress"  is NOT available
CHECK:
	"Diag_CalibrationNotPerformedError" := 'Detected'  //(Based on ELSE case of Requirement 102019)


Note: 
Negative case for  AAC_AzimuthAutoalignmentCustomerCalibrationProgress (is) (is not) available LESS than 2s after StartUp is ignored due to these two conditions are combined and complement each other, so it's not possible for testing (aligned with Dev and SE)

Success criteria
System Test Scenario 1 : 
Start with a non calibrated ECU and check that DTC 0x000024 Kalibrierung  is active and error "Diag_CalibrationNotPerformedError" := 'Detected'.
Calibrate ECU and check  DTC 0x000024 Kalibrierung is not qualified anymore and "Diag_CalibrationNotPerformedError" := 'NotDetected'

System Test Scenario 2:
Start with a calibrated ECU and force ECU to be in "SysStM_StateInfo" != 'ApplSW_ACTIVE->perform a reset and wait 2 seconds and check that DTC 0x000024 Kalibrierung  is Not active 

Software Test Scenario 1 :
Start with a calibrated ECU ->perform a reset and wait 2 seconds then force "AAC_AzimuthAutoalignmentCustomerCalibrationProgress" == 90% AND "Diag_CalibrationNotPerformedError" := 'Detected'

Software Test Scenario 2 :
Start with a calibrated ECU and force ECU to be in "SysStM_StateInfo" != 'ApplSW_ACTIVE->perform a reset and wait 2 seconds then force  "AAC_AzimuthAutoalignmentCustomerCalibrationProgress" == is not sent  by AAC AND "Diag_CalibrationNotPerformedError" := 'NotDetected'

Software Test Scenario 3 :
Start with a calibrated ECU and force ECU to be in "SysStM_StateInfo" = 'ApplSW_ACTIVE->perform a reset and wait 2 seconds then force "AAC_AzimuthAutoalignmentCustomerCalibrationProgress" == is not sent by AAC AND "Diag_CalibrationNotPerformedError" := 'Detected'

[PO_01_RS_102019]
The function "Diag UDS Processing" shall «set "Diag_CalibrationNotPerformedError" as follows:

//Step_2: Plausibility with ACC Progress Input.
IF
	AAC_AzimuthAutoalignmentCustomerCalibrationProgress is available more than 2s after StartUp. //2s is elapsed after step_1 (PO_01_RS_102017)
AND
	"SysStM_StateInfo" != 'ApplSW_ACTIVE
THEN
	"Diag_CalibrationNotPerformedError" := 'NotDetected'
ELSE
	"Diag_CalibrationNotPerformedError" := 'Detected'
».

Verification method 
Functional test
Verification environment
Diagnostic tester or restbus simulation or vehicle
Verification constraints
1. "Developement_Message_active"-DTC (0xC0008A) is NOT set
2a. Enable CAN debug messages via "[Group 3 Xcp].bit 5"
and/or
2b. Activate Development Message (Can or Ethernet) through DID 0x0902

Success criteria
"Developement_Message_active"-DTC (0xC0008A) is set

Negative Case
If "[Group 3 Xcp].bit 5" is disabled
AND
If Development Message (Can or Ethernet) through DID 0x0902 is NOT activated 
=> "Developement_Message_active"-DTC (0xC0008A) is NOT set

		"Diag_VEICDevelopmentCommunicationEth" == 'not activated',

		Diag_XcpActivationStatus_CFG  == 'not activated'. //implement in Plattform see (XcpQmActiveError)»,

ELSE: «
 		-set "Diag_DevelopmentMessageCommunicationActiveError" := 'Detected'.
» .
